comment: Falkbeer's Countergambit, the most vigorous reply to King's Gambit.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3
comment:
An ingenious and daring developing sacrifice, killing two birds with
one stone: White's development is hindered, and the K-file is opened for
direct attack on the White King.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2
comment:
Black has cleary
obtained more than adequate compensation for the sacrificed central pawn: two
tempos and an open file.  8...

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2 Bxc3
comment: It stands to reason to get rid of the active Knight.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2 Bxc3 9. bxc3 Re8+ 10. Be2 Bg4
comment:
Essentially one more developing sacrifice. Refusing to lose valuable time
by capturing the QP  - after 10...Nxd5 11.Nf3 White just manages to complete
his development - Black continues to press the opponent.Now White's KN will
find it far from simple to enter the game.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2 Bxc3 9. bxc3 Re8+ 10. Be2 Bg4 11. c4 c6
comment:
Undermining the
center, Black intends to force the development of his Queenside pieces.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2 Bxc3 9. bxc3 Re8+ 10. Be2 Bg4 11. c4 c6 12. dxc6 Nxc6 13. Kf1 Rxe2

1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 e4 4. Nc3 Nf6 5. d3 Bb4 6. Bd2 e3 7. Bxe3 O-O 8. Bd2 Bxc3 9. bxc3 Re8+ 10. Be2 Bg4 11. c4 c6 12. dxc6 Nxc6 13. Kf1 Rxe2 14. Nxe2 Nd4 15. Qb1 Bxe2+ 16. Kf2 Ng4+ 17. Kg1 Nf3+ 18. gxf3 Qd4+ 19. Kg2 Qf2+ 20. Kh3 Qxf3+ 21. Kh4 Ne3 22. Rg1 Nf5+ 23. Kg5 Qh5#
comment:
In this game, the advantage in development steadily increased through thematic
sacrifices, the leitmotif of all Black's strategy.
